etymology.description: 水(水) (shuǐ, 'water') + 主(主) (zhǔ, 'master') = semantic element of water + phonetic component -> concentrate; pour
etymology.interpretation: The character 注(注) (zhù, 'concentrate; pour') combines the idea of water with the phonetic component 主(主) (zhǔ, 'master'). The association with water suggests a focus or pouring of attention, paralleling the concentrated flow of liquid.

examples.chinese: 请把热水注入杯中(請把熱水注入杯中)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ rèshuǐ zhù rù bēi zhōng.
examples.english: Please pour the hot water into the cup.

examples.chinese: 在课堂上(在課堂上)，他专心注视老师(他專心注視老師)。
examples.pinyin: Zài kètáng shàng, tā zhuān xīn zhù shì lǎoshī.
examples.english: In class, he concentrated on watching the teacher attentively.

examples.chinese: 他注重细节(他注重細節)。
